data.text: @christineychen It’s so hard with everyone having different concerns and risk tolerance. Isn’t parenting (and adulting) fun?

@christineychen Oh I feel for you!!! I hope you have a bubble of friends masking up to protect you and yours so you too get a little socialization. Seems a ridiculously small price to pay so everyone, even the high risk, gets a touch of normalcy. 🤞 that Pfizer figures it out soon for kiddos

@Marimikel And, uh, also this breaking news. 😫😭 As the parent of kids in this age group and the daughter of someone going through chemo, I’m just crossing my fingers and praying the numbers keep going down. https://t.co/RaVCCAYtKO
@christineychen …which really is also rather racist as underserved communities have more comorbidities and higher risk but hey, the healthy wealthy crowd gets to be a smidge more comfy!

@christineychen Using hospitalizations as the core metric is basically saying ‘we don’t care if the disabled & immunocompromised die.’ @bouldercohealth & #BoulderCityCouncil have made it clear they do NOT care about the disabled community.
@ciaoamy Yeah we’ve been having lots of convos in our household about when our kids will unmask at school, and no decisions here yet.
@christineychen Yeah. We are waiting for 50 cases per 100K over here…
@christineychen @bouldercohealth @CDCgov Since going maskless my kids’ SVVSD Covid tracking site says there are 0 current cases in the school. I find this impossible to believe.

@CDCgov now using hospital data to indicate Covid severity in counties. Fine. But to expect ppl to know how to handle the masking situation with these rapidly changing guidelines w/ v little notice? And the counties can’t catch up w/ methodology? Well, yeah. Ppl are confused.

Now before y’all get mansplainy/personsplainy, yes — I know why this is so. Last Friday’s data shows us at ~150 cases per 100k ppl in the last 7 days. @bouldercohealth is still using # of cases as their metric to show community transmission. @CDCgov upended all of that on Friday. https://t.co/pcmFFjBPer
